id: unique id of entry in corpus, probably as UUID

source.url: URL where the dataviz was found
alt-urls: Alternate URLs where the dataviz can be found

article.article_url: URL of article that contained the dataviz
article.article_title: title of article that contained the dataviz
article.article_subheadline: text of sub-headline of article that contained the dataviz
article.article_text: URL to text of article that contained the dataviz
article.doi: article's Digital Object Identifier, see https://www.doi.org/
keywords: keywords or subject tags of article that contained the dataviz

data.url: URL to data used in the dataviz

dataviz.title: title of the dataviz

caption.headline: headline of caption from article that contained the dataviz
caption.text: text of caption from article that contained the dataviz

formats._file_type_: URL to repo's version of the dataviz in this MIME type format, based on the common file extension, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types/Common_types
formats.svg: URL to SVG version in repo
formats.png: URL to PNG version in repo
formats.jpg: URL to JPEG version in repo
formats.pdf: URL to PDF version in repo

dataviz.type: overall type of dataviz, e.g. bar chart, line chart, scatterplot, etc.
keywords: keywords or subject tags about the dataviz
keywords or subject tags by categorizers

line_trends.schema: URL to metadata scheme for format of pattern data

dataset.series_id: UID of series this trend contains, e.g. primary key or row header
dataset.series_label: human-readable label of series this trend contains, e.g. primary key or row header

trends._meta_: trends found in this series, in order

dataset.series_id: another UID of series this trend contains, e.g. primary key or row header
dataset.series_label: another human-readable label of series this trend contains, e.g. primary key or row header

trends._meta_: trends found in this series, in order

scatter_clusters.schema: URL to metadata scheme for format of pattern data

studies._study_id_1_: URL to specific data with IDs of reviewers, coders, annotators, etc., and their comments and observations
studies._study_id_2_: another URL to the same data from another study
